title: Laura Kelly
added: Throughout the pandemic, Kelly's Department of Labor struggled with rampant fraud relating to claims for unemployment compensation, with a small business owner describing it as "millions and millions of dollars of taxpayer-funded money that has been negligently spent."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Bahl|first=Andrew|title=Unemployment questions remain for employers, Kansans as legislators tackle problem|url=https://www.cjonline.com/story/news/state/2021/02/12/kansas-unemployment-search-where-find-jobs-questions-employees-state-legislature/4440661001/|access-date=2021-02-12|website=The Topeka Capital-Journal|language=en-US}}</ref> Issues began around June, when Labor Secretary Delia Garcia was forced to resign because the state paid out approximately $7 million in duplicate unemployment payments and was forced to claw the money back, resulting in an untold amount of overdraft charges for unemployed Kansans already struggling through the pandemic.

title: Laura Kelly
added: Throughout the pandemic, Kelly's Department of Labor struggled with rampant fraud relating to claims for unemployment compensation, with a small business owner describing it as "millions and millions of dollars of taxpayer-funded money that has been negligently spent."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Bahl|first=Andrew|title=Unemployment questions remain for employers, Kansans as legislators tackle problem|url=https://www.cjonline.com/story/news/state/2021/02/12/kansas-unemployment-search-where-find-jobs-questions-employees-state-legislature/4440661001/|access-date=2021-02-12|website=The Topeka Capital-Journal|language=en-US}}</ref> Issues began around June, when Labor Secretary Delia Garcia was forced to resign because the state paid out approximately $7 million in duplicate unemployment payments and was forced to claw the money back, resulting in an untold amount of overdraft charges for unemployed Kansans already struggling through the pandemic.<ref>{{Cite web|title=ðŸŽ¥ $7M error led to Kan. Labor Secretary's resignation|url=http://hayspost.com/posts/9ceb8f49-499e-4540-bffd-d84d9e338a66|access-date=2021-02-12|website=Hays Post|language=en-US}}</ref> Since Garcia's resignation, Kelly has cycled through three additional Labor Secretaries.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Staff|first=KWCH|title=Amber Shultz named as Kansas Department of Labor Secretary|url=https://www.kwch.com/2021/01/29/amber-shultz-named-as-kansas-department-of-labor-secretary/|access-date=2021-02-12|website=https://www.kwch.com|language=en}}</ref>

title: Laura Kelly
added: Kelly's response to the pandemic has been generally viewed as a negative, with her approval ratings dropping from the mid-60's down to 46% as of August 2020.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-09-16|title=Governor Kelly sees approval rating drop|url=https://www.fourstateshomepage.com/news/governor-kelly-sees-approval-rating-drop/|access-date=2021-02-12|website=KSNF/KODE - FourStatesHomepage.com|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Laura Kelly
deleted: In June, Kelly's Labor Secretary Delia Garcia was forced to resign because the state paid out approximately $7 million in duplicate unemployment payments and was forced to claw the money back, resulting in overdraft charges for unemployed Kansans who had applied for the benefits.<ref>{{Cite web|title=ðŸŽ¥ $7M error led to Kan. Labor Secretary's resignation|url=http://hayspost.com/posts/9ceb8f49-499e-4540-bffd-d84d9e338a66|access-date=2021-02-12|website=Hays Post|language=en-US}}</ref> Since Garcia's resignation, Kelly has appointed three different individuals to fill the role of Labor Secretary, with the most recent being Amber Shultz.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Staff|first=KWCH|title=Amber Shultz named as Kansas Department of Labor Secretary|url=https://www.kwch.com/2021/01/29/amber-shultz-named-as-kansas-department-of-labor-secretary/|access-date=2021-02-12|website=https://www.kwch.com|language=en}}</ref>

title: Laura Kelly
added: According to the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]] data tracker, as of February 2021 Kansas ranks 49th of 50 states in vaccine doses administered per capita.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|last=Tidd|first=Jason|date=February 8, 2021|title=Kansas COVID vaccination rates remain low, rank 49th of 50 states in CDC report|url=https://www.kansas.com/news/coronavirus/article249095875.html|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=}}</ref> State health officials have said the number of doses administered is believed to be higher than reported as vaccination sites have emphasized getting shots in arms over sending timely documentation to local, state and federal government agencies.<ref name=":1" />

title: Laura Kelly
added: Throughout the duration of the pandemic, Kansas has ranked among the bottom of all states in the pace of unemployment recovery.<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=|title=Kansas has slowest weekly unemployment claims recovery in nation|url=https://www.wibw.com/2020/08/29/kansas-has-slowest-weekly-unemployment-claims-recovery-in-nation/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=|title=Report: Kansas last in the nation for unemployment recovery|url=https://www.kwch.com/2020/09/03/report-kansas-last-in-the-nation-for-unemployment-recovery/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=}}</ref>
